intro: Collomia gracilis var. eritrichoides, commonly known as the slender collomia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its hairy stems and showy blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, often in open habitats such as meadows and dry slopes. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. This variety is distinguished by its slender stems and smaller, more delicate flowers compared to other varieties of Collomia.
